title: Text
$comment:
Intended mostly for use for inline text e.g. the text in a paragraph.

Differs from the primitive `String` type in that it has a `type` and `id` property.
The `id` property allows use to identify text nodes with a sequence of inline nodes
for better diffing.

Also, in Rust, the `value` property is implemented as a CRDT.

type.$comment: This is a special property analogous to JSON-LD's `@type` keyword.

id.$comment: This is a special property analogous to JSON-LD's `@id` keyword.

value.description: The value of the text content

min.description: Generate a fixed string of text.

low.description: Generate a random string of up to 10 alphanumeric characters.

high.description: Generate a random string of up to 100 alphanumeric characters, some special characters commonly used in prose, and whitespace.
